title: Four people are killed and three are injured in early morning shooting outside a Brooklyn nightclub
text:
Four people have been killed and five are injured after a shooting outside a nightclub in New York on Saturday.

The deceased are four men who were pronounced dead at the scene. A woman and two men suffered non-life-threatening injuries.

The shooting incident took place on the border of Crown Heights and Weeksville neighborhoods in Brooklyn just before 7am.

Two people were taken in for questioning in the early stages of the investigation as law enforcement investigated whether the incident was connected to a hip-hop festival taking place this weekend.

Nine people were shot outside a nightclub in Brooklyn on Saturday and four people have died

A witness at the scene was heard saying a woman had been taken away from the scene in handcuffs. The Citizen app also reported a man was in handcuffs

Brooklyn | Crown Heights | 74 Utica Ave.

4 people shot and pronounced DOA. 3 others hospitalized. pic.twitter.com/zbnCFF12Gr — New York City 911 (@NYC_Alerts911) October 12, 2019

Rolling Loud is scheduled on Saturday and Sunday at Citi Field, Queens with the likes of A$AP Rocky, Travis Scott and Tyga on the line-up.

NYPD units have given conflicting information regarding how many shooting victims there are, but it's believed there were at least nine injured.

All victims of the incident at 74 Utica Avenue, near Atlantic Ave, were being transported to the hospital.

Between Kings County Hospital and Brookdale University Hospital Medical Center, the hurt attendees of what appeared to be an after-hours nightclub were believed to be seriously injured.

A witness at the scene was heard saying: 'That dude there in the ambulance caught it in the arm. He's lucky.'

A woman had been taken away from the scene in handcuffs, according the the witness reaction.

The Citizen user's video also shows police with a man in handcuffs.

#BREAKING: at least 4 people are dead, 5 others are injured after a shooting in #Brooklyn. So far, no one has been arrested. It happened in the Weeksville section, possibly at a private social club. @CBSNews @CBSNewYork pic.twitter.com/cRLzINWR5F — Marc Liverman (@MarcLiverman) October 12, 2019

All victims of the incident at 74 Utica Avenue, near Atlantic Ave, were being transported to the hospital. They were seriously injured at what appeared to be an after-hours nightclub

The witness filming the video is also heard saying: 'They must have gotten away in the car that ran that light.'

It's unclear at this time whether the location is a private social club or a rental space but Triple A Aces Private & Social Rental Space is located where the events took place.

'Unbelievable and they're right up the block from the precinct,' the witness was heard exclaiming. 'They're bold.'

It was three blocks away from the NYPD 77th Precinct.
description: Four men are dead and five people are injured after a shooting outside an after-hours nightclub in Brooklyn, New York on Saturday before 7am.
